edu.nyu.cs.canvas.view

Class CanvasView

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.nyu.cs.canvas.view.CanvasView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanvasObserver

    public class CanvasView
extends java.lang.Object
implements CanvasObserver
    This is the view class that implements the observer The top panel has grid of buttons for launching application specific commands The middle panel stores the actual canvas for drawing
    Author:
    abhishek
    See Also:
    The bottom panel stores controls for adjusting paint properties NOTE: To close the current view, press the close view button in the top action panel. To exit out of the application(and closing all views) use standard exit window

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int canvasCount 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CanvasView(CanvasController controller)
      Constructor for the view object, creates a view object and ties it to a controller so that it can send/receive updates to/from model via controller

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeColor(java.awt.Color color)
      receives a notification from controller to update the current color with the updated value from model
      void changeStroke(int stroke)
      receives a notification from controller to update the current stroke with the updated value from model and change the slider accordingly
      void copyContent(java.util.ArrayList<CanvasPoint> allPoints)
      receives a notification from controller to draw a new stateful view if a new view is required to have it(stateful fork is requested by one of the existing views
      void displayView()
      makes the current view UI visible
      void drawLine(CanvasPoint startPoint, CanvasPoint endPoint)
      Controller invokes this method to draw a line between current start and end points
      CanvasPanel getCanvas()
      returns the canvas element of the view
      java.awt.Color getColor()
      getter for the paint property 'color' in view
      CanvasPoint getEndPoint()
      getter for the last updated endpoint of the point/line drawn
      int getID()
      getter for the ID of the current view

      getter for the main frame of the view

      getter for the 'prospective' start point for a new line/point
      int getStroke()
      getter for the paint property 'stroke' in view
      void reset()
      whenever a reset is requested, controller notifies all view to reset their paint properties and repaint.
      void setStartPoint(CanvasPoint endPoint)
      receives the notification from controller about updating the new start point once a point/segment has been drawn
